basics.name: Hong (Louie) Yao
basics.label: Predictive Modeling Analyst & Physicist
basics.summary: Physicist-turned-data-scientist with a Ph.D. in Physics from Virginia Tech. Specializes in machine learning for insurance pricing and risk modeling, NLP/LLM research, and quantum computing. Published researcher in AI/ML, quantum information, and statistical physics.

work.name: The Cincinnati Insurance Company
highlights: Led a collaborative research project with Ohio State University leveraging language modeling for homeowner pricing: applied DPO to rank zip-code-level risk, and used LLM-based summarization and embedding of demographic, social media, and crime data for territory-level risk tiering.
Led development of an Azure-hosted GPT-based assistant using RAG, enabling underwriters to query predictive models, documentation, and risk factors via natural language.
Improved territory factor modeling by introducing graph-based smoothing and clustering methods inspired by Graph Neural Networks, integrating spatial, locational, and demographic information.
Designed and deployed a predictive model to identify policies requiring inspection; contributed approximately $1M in annual premium uplift.
Conducted large-scale feature analysis across 1,000+ candidate variables to identify robust predictors for homeowner rating and underwriting models.

work.name: The Cincinnati Insurance Company

projects.name: Easy21 Reinforcement Learning
projects.summary: Implemented the Easy21 card game from David Silver's RL course. Trained tabular Monte Carlo and TD agents, and implemented a Sarsa(λ) agent with linear function approximation.

projects.name: QCNN for Phase Identification (QHack 2024)
projects.summary: Developed and trained quantum convolutional neural networks (QCNNs) for phase identification using a GPU-accelerated simulator. Evaluated robustness on IonQ's device through AWS Bracket. Won 3rd place and Amazon Braket Prize.

projects.name: NanoGPT
projects.summary: Trained a nano GPT model (11M parameters) from scratch with a decoder-only architecture featuring 6 causal multi-head self-attention blocks. Used a custom Byte Pair Encoding tokenizer trained on Shakespeare; language model trained on Hemingway.
